news.title: Line-up for first show of new the Late Late Show season boasts Guests Margot Robbie, Colin Farrell and Michael Flatley
news.summary: Other guests include Irish rugby player Conor Murray and former Irish president Mary Robinson, with a musical performance from Kodaline's Steve Garrigan.

news.title: The Weeknd adds extra Croke Park date
news.summary: Tickets will go on sale on September 12.

news.title: Liam Neeson to Produce The Lost Children of Tuam directed by Frank Berry
news.summary:
Monica Dolan is set to lead the cast of the Irish feature. 
Alongside Dolan, the cast will also include Andrew Bennett and Ian McElhinney.

news.title: Vona Groarke appointed as Ireland Professor of Poetry
news.summary: "She has shaped a body of work remarkable for its lyric beauty and its acute and attentive gaze upon the world around us," said President Michael D. Higgins of Groarke.

news.title: Dr. Moling Ryan appointed as Interim Director of the Arts Council
news.summary: Dr. Ryan replaces Maureen Kennelly as Interim Director of the Arts Council.

news.title: David Bowie's favourite songs revealed, including 'Across the Universe' and 'Tom Violence'
news.summary: The David Bowie Centre is set to open on September 13.

news.title: Bad Bunny excludes US from tour over fears of ICE raids at concerts
news.summary: The Debí Tirar Más Fotos World Tour sees the musician play multiple dates across South America, Europe and Australia at the end of the year and into the new year.

news.title: Nicky Ryan, producer of Enya, has died
news.summary: Hot Press is desperately sad to hear that one of Ireland’s musical greats – the man who guided Enya through her remarkably successful career – has passed away...

news.title: David Lyttle launches new jazz club in Belfast
news.summary: Dock Street Jazz Club will host performances by renowned and up-and-coming jazz musicians every Sunday from 8:00 p.m..

news.title: RTÉ: "Ireland will not take part in the 2026 Eurovision Song Contest if the participation of Israel goes ahead"
news.summary: "RTÉ feels that Ireland’s participation would be unconscionable given the ongoing and appalling loss of lives in Gaza," a statement from the broadcaster reads.
